org.fhnw.aigs.TicTacToe.server

Class GameLogic

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.fhnw.aigs.commons.Game
      • org.fhnw.aigs.TicTacToe.server.GameLogic

  • public class GameLogic
extends org.fhnw.aigs.commons.Game
    This class represents the game logic part of TicTacToe. The size is defined in the variables xFields and yFields which are set in the constructor.
    The game logic contains a multidimensional array of TicTacToeFields which represent the fields, see ticTacToeFields.
    v1.0 Initial release
    v1.1 Functional changes (package)
    v1.1.1 Minor changes
    Author:
    Matthias St√∂ckli (v1.0)

    • Field Detail

      • ticTacToeFields

        private TicTacToeField[][] ticTacToeFields
        The fields of the TicTacToe game. The first dimension represents the x-axis, the second the y-axis. Therefore ticTacToeFields[1][1] returns the field in the middle of the board.

      • xFields

        private final int xFields
        The number if fields in the x-axis (3)

      • yFields

        private final int yFields
        The number of fields in the y-axis (3)

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameLogic

        public GameLogic()
        Empty constructor which is necessary in order to load the game.
        Don't forgett to set the same game name in the class TicTacToeMain in the package 'client'.

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public void initialize()
        See Game.initialize() for more information about the way this method works.
        This implementation checks for the GameMode. If SinglePlayer has been chosen, a new player (the AI) will be generated and added to the list of players. Afterwards, a random player will be picked, he or she will begin the game. then, the game will be started.
        Specified by:
        initialize in class org.fhnw.aigs.commons.Game

      • setUpFields

        private void setUpFields()
        Creates the (logical) fields of the game and fills them into ticTacToeFields.

      • processGameLogic

        public void processGameLogic(org.fhnw.aigs.commons.communication.Message message,
                             org.fhnw.aigs.commons.Player sendingPlayer)
        See Game.processGameLogic(org.fhnw.aigs.commons.communication.Message, org.fhnw.aigs.commons.Player) for more information about the way this method works.
        ProcessGameLogic processes all the messages that control the flow of this game.
        Specified by:
        processGameLogic in class org.fhnw.aigs.commons.Game
        Parameters:
        message - The message passed from ServerMessageBroker.
        sendingPlayer - The player who sent the message.

      • checkForWinningCondition

        public void checkForWinningCondition()
        Checks whether one of the player meets the winning conditions: A full row, a full column or three diagonal fields.
        Specified by:

      • cfp

        private boolean cfp(int x,
                    int y,
                    org.fhnw.aigs.commons.Player p)
        Checks whether a player controls a field.
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate of the field.
        y - The y coordinate of the field.
        p - The player to be checked against.
        Returns:
        True if the given player controls the field.

      • calculateDraw

        private boolean calculateDraw()

      • aiAction

        private void aiAction()
        The AI is controlled by this method. In this game the AI does not act very intelligent. It simply takes a random field which is still not occupied.
